headline: The Score: Meta Platforms, Moderna, Edison International and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: Meta Platforms  is ending fact-checking and speech restrictions across Facebook and Instagram, as Chief Executive  Mark Zuckerberg  embraces a second Trump presidency.  Starting in the U.S., Meta will be replacing fact-checkers with a so-called Community Notes system.  Zuckerberg built up Facebook’s content-policing efforts in the wake of Trump’s first presidential election.

headline: Fox Must Face Smartmatic’s Defamation Lawsuit, Appeals Court Rules
summary: A New York state appeals court rejected  Fox  bid to throw out a defamation lawsuit by Smartmatic over false claims that the voting technology company helped rig the 2020 presidential election.  Smartmatic alleges that Fox Corp., Fox News and some of its hosts amplified misinformation that hurt its business and caused reputational harm.  The voting technology business is seeking billions in damages.
